So I was super exited to find a mobile version of it...until I started playing. The whole idea of the game is to use and make resources needed to upgrade houses while using simoleions to fulfill the needs of your sims. This is great until you go bankrupt and you have to upgrade buildings to get cash which in turn levels you up and unlocks even more things you can't afford but need. The only reason this is a 2 is because it looks great. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e \u003ca class\u003d\"id-no-nav play-button tiny\" href\u003d\"#\" \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eGame built for in-app purchases, not fun.\u003c/span\u003e The pacing on this game is incredibly slow unless you're willing to spend $50 a day on in game money (not an exxageraton, look at the prices). The in game trading with other players could fix this but the system doesn't allow to sort by the resources you want to buy, and they are usually gone by the time you're done loading the other players city (which you have to do to trade with them).  The game runs smoothly on my Galaxy note4 but eats battery like nothing I've ever seen. In short don't waste your time. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e \u003ca class\u003d\"id-no-nav play-button tiny\" href\u003d\"#\" target\u003d\"_blank\"\u003e I had hope when getting this game, and have been searching for an app that had the same style as the computer version. Unfortunately to say after level 5 it becomes impossible to do anything without buying in-game money. I have found that EA has skewed too far of course than what I expected. They have become corrupted by the standard \"pay to win\" style apps. rate-review\" title\u003d\" Unhelpful \" data-rating\u003d\"UNHELPFUL\"\u003e \u003cdiv class\u003d\"icon thumbs-down\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e \u003c/div\u003e \u003c/div\u003e \u003c/div\u003e \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eNeeds work\u003c/span\u003e As expected, the game is addicting, it's your typical \"wait time or spend money to get items\" game. The economy needs work, if a building costs 4x 1 hour items to upgrade, you should receive significantly more money out of the upgrade than say a building requiring 2x 10 minute items. Right now, the money received from an upgrade seems sheerly based on quantity of items. The items needed to increase storage capacity or open new land should not be counted in the overall inventory capacity, since, you may get many duplicates. Or, dumb it down to 1 kind of item for upgrading inventory, and one kind for upgrading land. There's too much inventory space wasted on those items that you can use only so often. Also, there should be a confirmational panel on the global trade hq before you go to another city. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e \u003ca class\u003d\"id-no-nav One problem I have is when there is a fire and I build a fire station they drive past the burning building and do nothing. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eAnother freeium game\u003c/span\u003e So sick of games like these. It's a fun game and it looks great but as usual you're forced to wait for \"items\" that are \"necessary\" to upgrade structures. So it's either wait or spend money. If you don't mind waiting for things then this game will be fine for you. But if you actually wanted a sim city experience on your phone... This isn't it. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e \u003ca class\u003d\"id-no-nav play-button tiny\" href\u003d\"#\" target\u003d\"_blank\"\u003e Full Review \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eLove this game.\u003c/span\u003e Haven't spent any money. On level 15, 72,000+ residents and no issues with my city services. Just build slow and strategically. Place the residential zones. Build the lots that will cause your population to grow the fastest with the resources you have (build lots that will increase your population by +1800 vs. only +52). If the lots aren't built on, then the lots don't need services. Build when you can afford to expand the services. Until then... Be patient. The electronic money will come. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e \u003ca class\u003d\"id-no-nav play-button tiny\" href\u003d\"#\" target\u003d\"_blank\"\u003e \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eDon't be fooled\u003c/span\u003e This is NOT SimCity.  It's a rip-off of the other city builder games.  Instead of an actual city simulation, you're micro-managing individual buildings (jumping through hoop after hoop) trying to collect items.  The pictures look impressive, but it takes a whole lot of REAL money to build a city that looks like that.  Instead of designing and managing a city like in the traditional SimCity games, you're building a building every once in a while while spending all of your time collecting items. \u003cdiv \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eAnother generic freemium city builder\u003c/span\u003e The only change is that instead of waiting for a day for your buildings to be built, you wait for a day for materials to be made so that you can build your building. If you don't build them in time, people leave and you earn much less money which means it takes even longer to build the essential things. My Simcash disappears for no reason. The tax collection rate makes no sense at all. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eGreat Game, but flawed\u003c/span\u003e The game is fun for a fremium game to pass some time, but because new utilities are available too fast, you're will always be low on cash. To work around the low cash problem, don't expand. Instead, stay in the starter area with the proper utilities and keep bulldozing skyscrapers for lower level houses until you've reached 16 when all the utilities have been introduced. The game is a lot more bearable when you don't have to worry about building more utilities that suck up your hard earned cash. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e favorite phone game now. Players should be allowed to set their own price on items to match the supply and demand of items. I will be glad to rate this game 5 stars one this has been added. while. At first, I thought it was something to do with the factory, but the crash rate increased from there and anytime I take a developed product or buy one from trading areas, it crashes. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eOverall a good game\u003c/span\u003e The Global Trade HQ is one of the most broken mechanics in any phone-based game. It does have a pc-SIMcity feel, but it doesn't translate well to the smartphone platform. The items you are trying to buy are almost never available, partly because you have to transit thought several screens to try to buy an item. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eFun game with big problems\u003c/span\u003e This game would get five stars from me if the market system wasn't completely broken. I tap Trade HQ and it gives me a list of products for sale. I tap something I need and it takes me to someone else's city and pulls up all of the items they have for sale. But the problem is, the item I originally selected is almost never listed in their actual sales, and if it is, trying to buy it gives a message that says, \"Sorry, this item is no longer available.\" Makes the game extremely difficult. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e \u003ca class\u003d\"id-no-nav play-button tiny\" href\u003d\"#\" I hear a lot of people complaining about this and that but honestly if you're needing to buy coins or needing like 10 police stations or 10 fire departments then I suggest you demolish your city and start from square one. So far im in level 13, I have over $100k and around 80k sims . I have 24 skycrapers and only need two small police stations and 2 small fire departments to cover them all. title\u003d\" Spam \" data-rating\u003d\"SPAM\"\u003e \u003cdiv class\u003d\"icon spam-flag\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e \u003c/div\u003e \u003cdiv class\u003d\"play-button icon-button small rate-review\" \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eCould be great but very difficult\u003c/span\u003e The first few levels are really hard to generate enough money and resources, then it's okay until level 15 or so when you unlock health, more shops, and every road requires upgrades. You're very short on cash. The trick is to expand vertically instead of horizontally. Just because you have new residential zones available, doesn't mean you should place them. Upgrade buildings to increase your population, build parks, and keep people happy. Watch what's coming next when you level up and ensure you have enough to buy any extra services you unlock. Look up guides on the internet and you won't have to pay EA's ridiculous prices for their premium currency, SimCash. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e \u003ca However, as with all games like this, the fun wears off as you are required to start building the longer timed items. The reason I stopped playing it,  however, was because I wanted to build a 2x1 park parallel to a road, but because of the lack of manual rotation of buildings I could only build it perpendicular to the road, which didn't fit into my grid at all. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eChanged opinion...\u003c/span\u003e This game throws big extra costs at you at level-ups: suddenly there is the need to build sewerage for every home, for example. It is also almost impossible to save some money for this. And replenishing that with real €/£/$/¥ will be never-ending thus too expensive. Also, producing building materials is too much of a hassle. I would just like to manage my city, instead of making sure production keeps on going. (adding to this review...) ...still... I didn't uninstall. This game is very good challenge. I added stars, because I'm still enjoying it to keep it going and to see how I'll be able to manage this. I won't give a game that makes me manufacture plant seeds in a factory 5 stars, but right now, I think it deserves 5 for gameplay and graphics. ..so.. I'm still playing this. ..lol.. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e \u003ca class\u003d\"id-no-nav play-button tiny\" href\u003d\"#\" target\u003d\"_blank\"\u003e The problem is I can't find the resources I need in the Global Market. Overall, this game is just a 3D version of CityVille. I think this add on will suffice even though the price of stuff inside is sky high as you level up, this is manageable.. I know developers have to make money, but make it from those impatient players, who can't wait even a day, but waiting for a month or more to build something is absurd.  Also would be nice after returning to the game to have the same zoom level, angle and position where You left the game. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e \u003ca \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eFun, with drawbacks\u003c/span\u003e It's a fun little game, but there are some kinks that make it frustrating. Items move too fast through the global trade depot (if you manage to find the item you are looking for, most often by the time you get to that user's trading post the item has already been sold... There are also some minor grammar issues present on that screen). Growth slows down dramatically, and saving simoleans for all the services demanded by your citizens is tough. But I enjoy SimCity so I'll stick with it for now. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e \u003ca class\u003d\"id-no-nav play-button tiny\" href\u003d\"#\" \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eGreat Strategy Game\u003c/span\u003e I read all the negative reviews and I just don't understand what people are expecting. This is not a game that gives immediate rewards.  It starts out pretty fast paced but once you get to level 12-15 you have to be a little more strategic on how you play the game. You can't expect to pick it up and play for more than five minutes at a time. You have to let things build, sell a bunch of stuff, organize your resources, layout the blueprint of your city well in advance and work towards that goal. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eRemarkably polished. But...\u003c/span\u003e Right off the bat, let me just say that I genuinely enjoy the new SimCity for PC. So my issue here has nothing to do with the state of the franchise. The issue is that this game had so much potential to be something great, even still with a level of micro transactions. What we got instead is a game that seems more hell bent on telling you to stop playing it rather than trying to convince you to enjoy it. It's really unfortunate. In fact, I'd say it almost feels kind a parody of South Parks' own parody. :( \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e \u003ca class\u003d\"id-no-nav play-button tiny\" title\u003d\" Spam \" data-rating\u003d\"SPAM\"\u003e \u003cdiv class\u003d\"icon spam-flag\"\u003e\u003c/div\u003e \u003c/div\u003e \u003cdiv class\u003d\"play-button icon-button small rate-review\" \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-body\"\u003e \u003cspan class\u003d\"review-title\"\u003eAnother micro-payment game\u003c/span\u003e Fun at first but gets old quickly.  Wait times for resources are too long and upgrades cost too much ($40,000 for dept of education).  The amount of resources you can produce and store is very low unless you pay cash.  There is a global trading area but 9 times out of 10 the item is unavailable by the time you transfer to the persons town to purchase it.  You spend all of your time making resources so you can make other resources that require a large amount of wait time.  There is also limited zoom options which makes clicking on buildings difficult.  I wish it was more like the old school Sim City but sadly it's just another game that requires micro-payments if you want to advance in a timely manner.  Only  nice feature is that you can move buildings and roads without cost.  Sorry, but I can't recommend it. \u003cdiv class\u003d\"review-link\" style\u003d\"display:none\"\u003e \u003ca class\u003d\"id-no-nav play-button tiny\" href\u003d\"#\" target\u003d\"_blank\"\u003e
